page.title: 08ROYAL VISITS
page.content:
VISIT OF THE DUKE OF EDINBURGH
Morecambe Bay was crossed in a manner not seen since the coming of the railway when a group of horse-drawn vehicules, led by the Duke of Edinburgh drove a zig-zag course across the Bay on the 30th May 1985. The route was marked in the traditional way with branches stuck into the sand and mud. This had been done by the Guide to the sands, Mr. C. Robinson, who himself rode with the Duke. Large crowds witnessed the departure from the Silverdale shore and the arrival at Kents Bank.
